data.title: Netscape's Hahn decides to move on
data.meta_description: Netscape Communications chief technology officer Eric Hahn will leave the internet software company this week, just eight months after being named to the position, to pursue work with closely held companies as an investor.
data.text:
Netscape Communications chief technology officer Eric Hahn will leave the internet software company this week, just eight months after being named to the position, to pursue work with closely held companies as an investor.

Hahn, 38, will not be replaced, said Netscape spokeswoman Rosanne Siino. Instead, the company may name people to advisory roles within each product group, she said. Those people would report to Marc Andreessen, co-founder and executive vice president of products.
